column4: How do I install Windows XP and Ubuntu together on one drive but different partitions?
Do you have windows installed now

Install windows.. but create a partition that is smaller than the total size of your dirve...  once done insert the ubuntu cd and boot it and tell it to use all unallocated space and it will do the rest
can you tell me how it will work, Grub will load windows? I will have two partitions - first for Ubuntu(ext3) and second - for Windows(NTFS)
correct, grub will give you the option of windows or ubuntu, you can also select a default or either if you wish
I have dual booted for years.. quite easy
I just wanted some technical details, like how it works, where are ntldr and boot.ini to be located?
they will stay put on the first partition
Is there a way to remove any traces of Windows from first partition?
the first 512k on the mbr will point to grub on the ext3 of the ub install which will pick up your windows install.
perhaps you should explain more about what you are trying to accomplish
:) ok, I guess I should first install both OS and then be asking questions so as not ask too much :)

if you dont want people to know you have a windows partition, you could set the grub timer to 1 and even rename the menu option so that only hitting escape on boot would bring up a menu that still would not say windows
Ok, thanks for tips. Lemme see the thing.
